beats: I start by counting the 88 piano keys on the ferry's upright as the gulls squawk in time.
Then I add the 12 months I've spent coaching the crew's shanty harmonies between crossings.
Only half of them turn up tonight, so I halve my running total to match the duet that actually sings.
I toss in 31 for the days of our breezy October rehearsal challenge pinned to the noticeboard.
Finally, I subtract the 5 letters in the word 'SHORE' that I stencil across the sail before we dock.
maths.question: When the tide settles, what number am I humming about? ___
